intro: Grewia madagascariensis, commonly known as the red gum tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in spherical heads, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are red when mature. Grewia madagascariensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
